New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 12 月 2 日星期一 06:19:00 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Auckland charter boat mayhem: Police meet passengers at Viaduct after booze cruise turns violent https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-charter-boat-mayhem-police-meet-passengers-at-viaduct-after-booze-cruise-turns-violent/GFHUIBCWW5AXVOKXE4SFL7QYQQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-charter-boat-mayhem-police-meet-passengers-at-viaduct-after-booze-cruise-turns-violent/GFHUIBCWW5AXVOKXE4SFL7QYQQ/ George BlockThe booze cruise descended into anarchy on Saturday as fights broke out on board. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Police were seen waiting for a boat to dock at Auckland's Eastern Viaduct before arresting several men when they got off early Saturday evening. Photo supplied
Waimate water supply under do-not-drink notice as nitrate levels exceed limits https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waimate-water-supply-under-do-not-drink-notice-as-硝酸盐-levels-exceed-limits/XCFDTSCA4NHLVBE3KMLBONYCJA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waimate-water-supply-under-do-not-drink-notice-as-硝酸盐-levels-exceed-limits/XCFDTSCA4NHLVBE3KMLBONYCJA/ Do-not-drink notice issued in Waimate as nitrate levels breach safe limits. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 05:59:00 +0000 The maximum acceptable value (MAV) of nitrate in drinking water is 50 milligrams per litre. Photo / 123RF
Pharmac minister and chairwoman refuse to express confidence in chief executive Sarah Fitt https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/pharmac-minister-and-chairwoman-refuse-to-express-confidence-in-chief-executive-sarah-fitt/DRFD7CN5RREW3PS3HBOFXUHCG4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/pharmac-minister-and-chairwoman-refuse-to-express-confidence-in-chief-executive-sarah-fitt/DRFD7CN5RREW3PS3HBOFXUHCG4/ Adam PearseThe revelation came amid a scrappy start to Parliament's second scrutiny week. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 05:20:44 +0000 Pharmac chief executive Sarah Fitt (left) speaks as chairwoman Paula Bennett looks on, after the agency is criticised for a recent supplier switch. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Young Kiwi musician Samuel Bronnimann dies in UK after allegedly taking unidentified pills https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/young-kiwi-musician-samuel-bronnimann-dies-in-uk-after-allegedly-takeing-unidentified-pills/HQUAP2LXV5GZDMB3QX4TLSLFLQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/young-kiwi-musician-samuel-bronnimann-dies-in-uk-after-allegedly-takeing-unidentified-pills/HQUAP2LXV5GZDMB3QX4TLSLFLQ/ The young musician had been living in the United Kingdom for over a year. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 05:08:07 +0000 Samuel Bronnimann, 25 from Whanganui, died in the United Kingdom last month after allegedly taking unidentified pills.
Manurewa Marae data misuse claims: Investigation to report back soon on ‘sensitive issue’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/manurewa-marae-data-misuse-claims-investigation-to-report-back-soon-on-sensitive-issue/YC5WQXCAJVFGTE2D24B4RCRQZ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/manurewa-marae-data-misuse-claims-investigation-to-report-back-soon-on-sensitive-issue/YC5WQXCAJVFGTE2D24B4RCRQZ4/ Jamie EnsorNicola Willis says the findings may face 'public challenge'. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 05:02:41 +0000 Sir Brian Roche expects report findings soon - but not before Christmas. Photo / Marty Melville
Christmas Appeal: Sports groups’ donations boost tally to almost $45k at halfway mark https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/christmas-appeal-sports-groups-donations-boost-tally-to-almost-45k-at-halfway-mark/2QTEA5I4PNAZNDS3ASBFLJBIHE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/christmas-appeal-sports-groups-donations-boost-tally-to-almost-45k-at-halfway-mark/2QTEA5I4PNAZNDS3ASBFLJBIHE/ Kaitlyn MorrellHalfway through the appeal, donations are tracking well with large donations rolling in. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 04:38:17 +0000 Jordy Gastmeier, Warehouse Manager at Tauranga Community Foodbank, sorting through Christmas treats that have been donated. Photo / Alex Cairns
All NZ poultry exports on hold until country free of highly pathogenic bird flu https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/all-nz-poultry-exports-on-hold-until-country-free-of-highly-pathogenic-bird-flu/OFB7QRSCSFEERMVK3QZ5CYTG3Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/all-nz-poultry-exports-on-hold-until-country-free-of-highly-pathogenic-bird-flu/OFB7QRSCSFEERMVK3QZ5CYTG3Y/ 40,000 chickens are to be eradicated at Moeraki farm as a bird flu outbreak is contained. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 04:33:00 +0000 Biosecurity Minister Andrew Hoggard. Photo / RNZ / Samuel Rillstone
Thames-Coromandel District Council: A rainbow crossing is not a pedestrian crossing https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/thames-coromandel-district-council-a-rainbow-crossing-is-not-a-pedestrian-crossing/HCNW22DOOZA2LACYIWC63FUYJU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/thames-coromandel-district-council-a-rainbow-crossing-is-not-a-pedestrian-crossing/HCNW22DOOZA2LACYIWC63FUYJU/ Al WilliamsRainbow crossings not pedestrian crossings, council says. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 04:24:14 +0000 An artist's impression of a rainbow pedestrian crossing in Grahamstown, Thames.
Mass pilot whale stranding unfolding in Nelson’s Golden Bay https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mass-pilot-whale-stranding-unfolding-in-nelsons-golden-bay/POWFKURLPJB2XJVDNHYNWOGJAA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mass-pilot-whale-stranding-unfolding-in-nelsons-golden-bay/POWFKURLPJB2XJVDNHYNWOGJAA/ Katie OliverLocal medics working with the community and DoC rangers to refloat dozens of pilot whales. Mon, 02 Dec 2024 04:18:20 +0000 There has been a mass stranding of pilot whales in Nelson’s Golden Bay. Photo / Supplied
Yealands Wine Group: Renowned founder and entrepreneur Peter Yealands dies at 76 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/yealands-wine-group-renowned-Founder-and-entrepreneur-peter-yealands-dies-at-76/44KYJZBOKFGVHL5PFCESN57KIU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/yealands-wine-group-renowned-Founder-and-entrepreneur-peter-yealands-dies-at-76/44KYJZBOKFGVHL5PFCESN57KIU/ Paula HulburtPeter Yealands has died at 76 leaving a lasting legacy in wine.
